newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends up in kerb, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends up in kerb, seen stable.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed 0.05 up at 39.10 to the dollar in the kerb market on Sunday amid profit-taking in the dollar that had risen sharply on Saturday, dealers said.
They said large inflows of the dollar from abroad could keep the rupee around current levels for some time.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate remained unchanged at 35.5300/35.7077 rupees to the dollar set on August 13.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 9.80 percent from its previous close at 10 percent.
